content.description: Toy Box is the leftmost route starting off the main ledge. Clip 2 bolts up the bulging slab to gain the stemming corner above. Pushing and stemming past 2 more bolts (crux) leads up to the beautiful, gray, triangular headwall and the hand crack just below the 2-bolt anchor. It has some wild, tricky moves!

School's Out currently starts off the the midway ledge on the far left side of the Play Pen. Climb the hand crack in the left-leaning, left-facing corner on the far left side of the wall. (5.9) A short finger crack leads up under the dramatic roofs above. Follow 4 bolts out the left side of the powerful roof and up to the anchor. Mostly 5.9 climbing with the tricky 5.10+ roof!
content.protection: A few pieces of gear from 1" to 3" and bolts and a 2-bolt anchor with chains for descent.
content.location:
To approach School's Out, scramble around the far left side of the crag past the start of

Froggy Crack

. Currently, this starts off the midway ledge above the base of the left side.

content.description:
Teeter Totter Roof is an incredible feature that extends from the

Lil' School Girl

anchors over to the

Froggy Crack

anchors. It is a 30' arching roof crack with strenuous and sustained moves. The rock quality is amazingly beautiful! Clipping the anchors at the end is quite a challenge and probably the crux!
content.protection:
3/4"-3" cams protect this roof crack well.

Descend from the

Froggy Crack

anchors.

climbs.name: Recess
climbs.fa: Justin Day, Mark Miner, Drew Spaulding, Ty Hydrusko, Aug. '13

content.description: Start just behind the left side of the pine tree. After scrambling up the lower ledges (1 or 2 cam placements are suggested), gain the steep, challenging "recess" below the dramatic double roofs above. Powerful liebacks straight up through the roofs is the obvious crux of this pitch (5.10+). As of June 2, 2019, we added a bolt above the crux roof and reconfigured the 4th and 5th bolt to make for a smoother flow. Much better now!
content.protection: 7 bolts and a 2-bolt anchor with chains.

content.description: Pirate's Booty took quite a bit of work to clean up before it was acceptable.... It has 2-3 cruxes that are boulder problems over roofs. There are some sharp, crimpy edges that are quite memorable and powerful to crank on. The climbing is continuous and stays exciting right up to the anchor ledge at the top.
content.protection: 7 bolts and 2-bolt anchor w/chains. I strongly suggest placing a large cam 3"-4" in the horizontal crack before clipping the 1st bolt!

climbs.name: Old Man's Myth
climbs.fa: ??? on the original FA-(old school aid line)

content.description:
After some cleaning and excavating of the crack, I led this line with all natural gear in September '13. We had found an old piton that came out quite easily. It seems obvious some "Old Man" had been up there training for the bigger walls of Eldo, The Black, and beyond.... They may have climbed up to the right where the crack system splits into a Y (looks like fun free climbing too). There is a large "boot-shaped flake" to the left of the crack that is hollow and gonging when tested. It seems to be solidly connected at its top, but avoiding it is advised (hoping to extract this unwanted feature...). There is solid gear to the right and can be avoided.... A splitter finger crack leads up through some exciting finishing moves to share the same 2-bolt anchor with

Toy Box

.
content.protection: Nuts and cams to 2" protect this classic CCC spitter.

content.description:
Just to the left of

Toy Box

is an obvious crack that was completely choked with dirt, grass, weeds, moss, and bushes! After doing some major excavating, this little beauty is now a really fun, moderate, all natural gear pitch! After gaining the stemming corner near the top, climb out leftward on the arching flake and edges up to the 2-bolt anchor with chains.
content.protection: Thin gear to 3". There is now a 2-bolt anchor on top of this fun moderate located out left under the roof.

climbs.name: Froggy Crack
climbs.fa: Drew Spaulding, Dan Hackett, Geoff Bindeman, May '15

content.description: Start up the wide looking crack (4" cam) on the lower tier to gain the 2 upper sections of wide, chimney slot climbing. You will encounter 5.9 on all 3 tiers.... The final section has a bulging start (5.9) and finishes with some technical 5.9 too! The large ledges detract from the beauty of this pitch, but it is really fun nonetheless!
content.protection: Thin gear to 4". You will find 3 bolts along the way. There is a 2-bolt anchor with chains for the descent.
content.location:
Froggy Crack is located left of

Lil' School Girl

.

climbs.name: Child's Play
climbs.fa: Drew Spaulding, Justin Day, Sara Bria, August '13

content.description:
Child's Play was the 1st route we decided to bolt on the wall.

Start to the right of the pine tree and up through the roofs directly above the tree. We recently (JUNE 2nd, 2019)added a 1st bolt for a safer start! Clipping the 4th bolt has been the crux for some people.... SO, WE RELOCATED IT, SO IT'S MUCH EASIER TO CLIP NOW!!! Originally, we climbed past the 4th bolt to the right(10a), and also we've worked out the moves directly below and to the left of the 4th bolt (11+). Either way is fun! The climbing continues at 5.9 the rest of the way. My young toddler Bodhi got to witness me first lead this pitch, so I named it Child's Play.
content.protection: 8 bolts and a 2-bolt anchor. We recently added a 1st bolt for a safer start and relocated the 3rd bolt, so it's much easier to clip!

content.description:
Bulletin Board starts above the lower lefthand tier to the right of the

Froggy Crack

. Share the same start as

Froggy Crack

, and climb the diagonaling, steep finger crack to gain the striped, golden plaque above. Pass 2 bolts to make a long reach(crux) right to gain the vertical groove which leads up into the

Teeter Totter Roof

! Finish the pitch on the

T.T.R.
content.protection: Gear to 4" and a few bolts.
content.location:
Bulletin Board starts above the lower lefthand tier to the right of the

Froggy Crack

. Share the same start as

Froggy Crack

, and climb the diagonaling, steep finger crack to gain the striped, golden plaque above. Pass 2 bolts to make a long reach right to gain the vertical groove which leads up into the

Teeter Totter Roof

! Finish the pitch on the

T.T.R.
